issue.title: Signature From File
issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same feature request.
- [X] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible.
- [X] This issue only contains a request for one single feature, **not** multiple (related) features.

### App version

6.000

### Problem you are trying to solve

I keep a synchronized folder which contains my HTML email signatures, enabling me to have the same signature on Thunderbird on my laptop and desktop, but there is currently no app that will do the same on Android.

### Suggested solution

Add an option to select a file when setting a signature for an identity, and when composing a new email, load from that file each time.

### Screenshots / Drawings / Technical details

_No response_

comment.body: I fully support this feature request. HTML (including in signatures) was implemented in the K@-mail fork about 8 years ago. I understand that it is a volunteer run project, but I am not sure what is taking so long in K9-mail. Couldn't you have just included what the K@-mail guys did? Especially as it is set to be the Thunderbird for Android, HTML simply is a MUST in 2023. While HTML may not be an absolute requirement for private emails, show me a business email without a logo or some other formatting in the signature these days. And if I need a separate mail client to send my business emails, I might as well use the same client for my private ones as well, essentially rendering K9 superfluous. So please, make this a priority.

issue.title: Feature request: Show both real name *and* email address
issue.body:
In the current version you can only configure ti show either a correpondent's real name **or** his email address.
https://github.com/k9mail/k-9/wiki/Manual-GlobalSettings#show-correspondent-names

Many of my contacts use different email addresses. If they write from an email address which is not yet stored in the contact information then a saved contact can't be assigned and displayed, so it would be good to see the email address, and add it to the saved contact. Unless the email address is somehow related to the real name it's not easy to see who has sent the email.

On the other hand, I've recently received a couple of emails with a well-known real name, but a faked email address, If I only see the real name of an email containing a link to a web page I could easily assume this has been sent by a known person, and click on that link. However, if I can see the email address which is obviously not related to real name I can easily identify the email as phishing or spam.

So I'd really prefer to see both the real name **and** email address in the email list view as well as when the individual email is displayed.

comment.body: HTML (including in signatures) was implemented in the K@-mail fork about 8 years ago. I understand that it is a volunteer run project, but I am not sure what is taking so long in K9-mail. Couldn't you have just included what the K@-mail guys did? Especially as it is set to be the Thunderbird for Android, HTML simply is a MUST in 2023. While HTML may not be an absolute requirement for private emails, show me a business email without a logo or some other formatting in the signature these days. And if I need a separate mail client to send my business emails, I might as well use the same client for my private ones as well, essentially rendering K9 superfluous. So please, make this a priority.

commits.message: Add permissions screen to onboarding flow

comment.body:
Note: This seems to be …
a) … the right thing to do. We don't want to cancel handling the previous Effect when we receive another one.
b) … necessary so the permission screen is properly skipped on Android versions that don't support runtime permissions.

pull_request.title: Add onboarding screen to ask for Android permissions
pull_request.body: This removes the old onboarding module and creates several onboarding sub modules. - `:feature:onboarding:main` contains the navigation logic and binds the various onboarding modules together - `:feature:onboarding:welcome` contains the welcome screen (`strings.xml` files have moved; so we need to update Weblate to point to the new location) - `:feature:onboarding:permission` contains the new permission screen (needs a new component on Weblate)

issue.title: Dark Mode Widget Message List
issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same feature request.
- [X] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible.
- [X] This issue only contains a request for one single feature, **not** multiple (related) features.

### App version

6.603

### Problem you are trying to solve

Hi,
When using the Widget "K-9 Message List" to display my inbox on Android, I can only get it to display in light mode. My Android system is globally set to dark mode. Other Previous GitHub threads on this issue have been closed and linked to this thread [https://github.com/thundernest/k-9/issues/3728](https://github.com/thundernest/k-9/issues/3728). Despite this, I cannot configure Message List to be in dark mode, or find any information online on how to do this. I would prefer to use a dark mode widget since it's nicer on my eyes.

### Suggested solution

Is it possible to have a dark mode version of the K-9 Message List widget?

### Screenshots / Drawings / Technical details

_No response_

comment.body:
> Other Previous GitHub threads on this issue have been closed and linked to this thread https://github.com/thundernest/k-9/issues/3728. Despite this, I cannot configure Message List to be in dark mode, or find any information online on how to do this.

That's because there's no point in having multiple open issues each requesting the same feature. Issue #3728 is still open. That means this functionality hasn't been implemented yet.

Duplicate of #3728

issue.title: Adding multiple recipients to To, Cc, Bcc when not in Address Book not obvious or reliable
issue.body:
Please search to check for an existing issue (including closed issues, for which the fix may not have yet been released) before opening a new issue: https://github.com/k9mail/k-9/issues?q=is%3Aissue

### Expected behavior
Tell us what should happen

When trying to add multiple recipients to To, Bcc or Cc fields, provided these are in the Address Book, they are usually recognized and offered for selection by K9.
IOW, when one starts to type the name "bob". K9 offers "bob@example.net" for selection

However, IF one wants to include one or more 3rd parties as recipients but not insert them in one's Address Book (e.g. this is just a "one-time" message), it is not immediately obvious how to get K9 to "detect" and "accept" manually inserted (typed) email addresses.  They appear spelled out but create a "parsing error" message (nice job on K9 giving off a helpful error message btw.)

Desirable: detect that an email address has been inserted manually and "accept" it without undue delays.

### Actual behavior
Tell us what happens instead

I tried to include one or more 3rd parties as recipients (which were not part of my Address Book), K9 did not "detect" and "accept" these manually inserted (typed out) email addresses.  They appeared spelled out but created a "parsing error".

Trying to separate the email addresses with commas or semicolons did not help (same parsing error message). I had to discard the message, start from scratch and this time, K9 detected an email address had been typed manually and as soon as this detection takes place, one can see that K9 formats it as some type of "contact label", with an icon to the left, etc.  I was then able to type yet another recipient (also not included in address book) and then had to change field or do something with cursor so as to "prompt" K9 to detect that additional email address and accept it.

It is not immediately obvious what process to follow.in the above case.  And it does not seem to be robust or 100% reliable since I coudl not get K9 to detect the typed out email addresses the fist time; and on second time, with new message, had to fiddle with cursor to get K9 to detect these email addresses.

Note: K9 is a great email client and this is really _minor_.

### Steps to reproduce
1.start new email
2.add a recipient which is in the address book in the To: field (this step may not be necessary).
3.in the Cc: field type in the email address of someone NOT in the address book (nothing happens). Insert <space> then type in an addtional email address (also of someone not included in address book).
4. nothing happens at times (i.e. K9 does not detect there are additional email addresses inserted which are not part of the address book or does not "parse" them) so one is left wondering how to make K9 detect these manually typed addresses.

### Environment
K-9 Mail version:
5.403
Android version:
7.1
Account type (IMAP, POP3, WebDAV/Exchange):

comment.body:
This bug is not quite fixed, unfortunately.  I have a Note10+. 

I use the Texpand app to create 4-character codes to type things that I often use, such as my wife's email address.  (I originally write the codes in AutoHotkey for Windows, then imported them into Texpand.)

* In the Bcc: field  I type any email address.
* Then I type a comma, or semicolon, or space, or comma+space, or semicolon+space (I have tried them all).
* Then I type the code for my wife's email address.
* RESULT:  The dreaded red bang, with the note 'Error parsing address!'

I can also report:
* No such problem in the To: field
* No such problem if I begin to type her address, then select it from the dropdown list.

I use my Texpand codes all the time.  Can this bug also be fixed?

issue.title: Only display server settings after state has been loaded
issue.body: Only display the various UI widgets for entering/configuring server settings after the current values have been loaded. Otherwise the user might briefly see invalid/outdated state. This is especially noticeable when editing incoming server settings for a POP3 account because some IMAP-specific UI elements will first be displayed and then disappear.

issue.title: Display "sign in" screen after importing an account using OAuth 2.0
issue.body:
Currently the settings import code is still using part of the old setup code to show a sign in screen after importing an account using OAuth 2.0. 

https://github.com/thundernest/k-9/blob/2125358e5cd3cb4a8eba665878124b2e99433726/app/ui/legacy/src/main/java/com/fsck/k9/ui/settings/import/SettingsImportFragment.kt#L176-L183

We probably want to add a new Compose screen that uses `AccountOAuthView()` to display the UI. The code for the new screen needs to take care of saving the authorization state to the account.

issue.title: Save authorization state when editing server settings
issue.body: Editing server settings could lead to sign in via OAuth 2.0. When saving server settings we also need to persist the auth state.

pull_request.title: Add support for one-time (initialization) events
pull_request.body:
Add infrastructure to `BaseViewModel` to handle one-time events, i.e. events that should only trigger an action the first time the event is received; subsequent events are ignored.

Fixes #7291
